lead_paragraph: CHERBULIEZ--Theodore, formerly of Scarsdale, Dr. Cherbuliez died July 2 at home in South Freeport, ME. Born in Geneva, Switzerland, he came to the US for psychoanalytic training in 1959. Psychiatrist with Albert Einstein College of Medicine; Montefiore Hospital; Cornell Medical School, Westchester, and in private practice for 53 years. In Geneva, consulted annually since 1974 with clinicians on innovative approaches to child welfare. Master Beekeeper, past President of American Apitherapy Society and Apimondia Apitherapy Commission. A consummate Swiss, his passions included mountain climbing, piloting, recorder playing, baking bread, and caring for generations of cats. Survived by his adored wife of 56 years Susan; sister Isaline (Geneva); daughters Ariane (Steven Orzack, Nora; Cambridge, MA); Nicole (Seth Clayter, Isabel, Lauren; Portland, ME); Lisa (John Terry, Eloise, Madeline, Charlotte; Needham, MA); Diana (Vinalhaven, ME); and Juliette (Matthias Rothe, Lucie and father Michael Opperman; Minneapolis, MN). Donations in his honor may be given to Doctors Without Borders, or The Southern Poverty Law Center. 1/3
